meanings.sent1: The farmer watched the playful yeanling frolic in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: The shepherd counted the yeanlings in the flock to ensure they were all safe.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous yeanling managed to sneak into the feed shed and caused a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The yeanling's fleece was as white as freshly fallen snow.
meanings.sent5: The yeanling's bleat echoed through the hills, signaling the arrival of spring.

meanings.definition: To give birth to a lamb
meanings.sent1: The ewe began to yeanling in the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent2: The farmer helped the ewe yeanling successfully without any complications.
meanings.sent3: The ewe seemed to yeanling at the most inconvenient times, catching the farmer off guard.
meanings.sent4: The meadow was filled with the sound of ewes yeanling, welcoming new life into the world.
meanings.sent5: The ewe's eyes showed determination as she prepared to yeanling her first lamb.
